projects: [{"title":"Natural Disaster Predicition","start_date":"Oct 2018","description":"An AI-based Natural disaster prediction and protection system. Submitted in Microsoft's Codefundo++ ( Second runner-up ) IIT KGP.‚Ä¢ Worked on the development of the frontend and backend of our idea topredict the natural disaster and manage the after effects by automatingthe whole management procedure‚Ä¢ The whole idea was hosted on azure. Azure was used for database,server and resource groups to create the whole web app. Google apiwas used for routing and other geolocation purposes."},{"title":"MEDICAL-PRESCRIPTION OCR","start_date":"Feb 2018","description":"Worked in a team of 10 to develop a software to extract all relevant information from a medical prescription image using OpenCV and increase accuracy rate of the state-of-the-art handwritten character reorganization by applying error correction mechanism. Built a model using Symmetric Delete spelling correction algorithm for sloppy handwriting correction i.e the words were processed to check, if there is any spelling mistakes and predicting the correct words in the hand-written texts using a self built medical dictionary."},{"title":"Editorial Crawler","start_date":"May 2017","description":"The web crawler was made in Python using its BeautifulSoup library and crawled editorials from leading newspaper websites and saved them to our system"},{"title":"Memory Resident Unix-like File System","start_date":"Jan 2019","end_date":"Apr 2019","description":"Prof. Indranil Sen Gupta || CSE,IIT KharagpurImplemented a memory resident file-system which can be accessed using APIs, which allows users to create, delete, dump, restore file-system, copy files from pc to file-system and vice-versa, get status and information about various files."},{"title":"INVENTORY MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE","start_date":"Jan 2018","end_date":"Mar 2018","description":"Prof. Sudip Misra | CSE,IIT KharagpurDeveloped a Java based software using MySQL for database management that can be used by shop owner so that they can maintain their inventory inspired by just-in time(JIT) philosophy which prioritizes minimizing cash tied up in product over maximizing inventory buffer."},{"title":"TINY-C COMPILER","start_date":"Jan 2018","end_date":"Mar 2018","description":"Prof. Pralay Mitra | CSE,IIT KharagpurCompiler for tinyC, a subset of the C programming language made using flex,yacc, and gnu assembler targeted for x86-64 architecture.Developed lexer, parser, intermediate code generator and target code Generator for given Compiler specifications."},{"title":"TCP based FIle Transfer Protocol ","description":"Spring 2018 | Computer Networks Course Project- Implemented a basic version of File Transfer Protocol ( FTP ) with Client and Servers side along with handling any discrepancy to occur."}]

honors_and_awards.title: Second Position in Industry 4.0 Midsphere Hackathon
honors_and_awards.description: ‚Ä¢Developed an IOT project to monitor necrosis in a live operation by monitoring temperature as a function of rotational speed of the drill with the help of mindsphere time-series API. ‚Ä¢The web app generated live alerts during the operation and was able to give summary of each operation accessible from the dashboard. The database was hosted on Azure and the web app on Cloud Foundry.

honors_and_awards.title: Third position at Microsoft Codefundo++, 2018
honors_and_awards.description: ‚Ä¢Worked on the development of the frontend and backend of our idea to predict the natural disaster and manage the after effects by automating the whole management procedure in a team of 3 students. ‚Ä¢The whole idea was hosted on azure. Azure was used for database, server and resource groups to create the whole web app. Google api was used for routing and other geolocation purposes. ‚Ä¢Main modules include - Facial recognition, Routing, Safe spot monitoring.
